alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Charlton; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 11:57AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Nassau, northeastern Duval, Camden and eastern Charlton Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1157 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Hickox to Homeland to near St. George. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... St. Marys, Kingsland, Hilliard, Folkston, Woodbine, Callahan, Jacksonville International Arpt, Kings Bay Base, Yulee and Homeland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia.
